result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter from DMV

10:59 AM Defendant Bruce A. Greene in court.  Attorney Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Bruce A. Greene. Attorney Erickson states that he has received the DPA. Attorney Erickson review the document with the defendant. 

11:14 AM Same appearances. Attorney Erickson goes over the joint recommendation for entering a plea in count 1, 3, and 5. All other counts will be DRI. Attorney Forehand concur with the agreement that was stated by Attorney Erickson. Court goes over the agreement. Defendant enters a NC plea on all three counts. Court colloquy. Court finds a factual basis. No victim input was provided to the DA office. Attorney Erickson comments.


Count 1: Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 3 years.

Conditions:

Participate and Successfully complete Treatment Court.
Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.
No costs.
Credit in the event of revocation: 62 days
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.


Count 3: Court withhold the judgment of conviction and put the defendant on a DPA for 5 years.
Conditions of bond continues.


Count 5: Court imposes sentence

$350 fine plus costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the clerk.
$85 blood draw reimbursement to county agency, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
5 days in Richland County Jail, TIME SERVED.
12 months driver license revocation
12 months IID upon relicensing
AODA/Driver Safety Plan to be relicensed

Count 2 and 4- DRI


Court releases the bond and will send payment back to the individual that posted it.
jury instruction

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Hearing on the Notice of Intent to Revoke Operating Privileges

1:14 PM  Attorney Forehand appears by video for the state. Attorney McDougal appears by video for BG. BG appears by video from the Richland County Jail. Attorney Forehand states that this is Attorney Harper case but there is no request for change of cash bond. Attorney McDougal asks for a signature bond to allow BG to get some treatment. CC Schwarze denies the bond reduction.

1:38 p.m. Def by video from Richland County Jail; Atty. McDougal in court for the Def. DA Harper appeared by video for the State. Def is on a p/p hold. DA states intended charges in this matter; complaint not yet filed; would consider bond amendment to $1k cash. Atty. McDougal - Defense argues for less; states Def is not a flight risk and asks for signature bond. Court orders $1000 cash bond. 4/6 at 1 p.m. for an initial.

$2000.00
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.
